page.title: 16 LOWER APPERLEY 4
page.content: Some of the larger houses had a paddock for a horse or pony. We saw dairy cattle, mainly black and white Frisians together with sheep and goats grazing in the fields. The arable fields had wheat and barley growing in them and the drier meadows were being cut for silage or hay.(May/June). Most of the other people in the village unless they were retired, seemed to work in Tewkesbury or Cheltenham and a few in Gloucester. To the west of the River Severn there was some more low lying meadowland which can only be used for summer grazing or cropping for hay. This year, the hay cutting was late because of the very wet June. After the 2 public houses by the Haw Bridge there are no more houses until you reach the village of Tirley.
